label: A2BC4_oP56_56_2e_e_4e-001
title: Calciborite (CaB$_{2}$O$_{4}$ II) Structure
comments:
This structure has the same orthorhombic lattice constants as the CaB$_{2}$O$_{4}$ II structure identified in (Marezio, 1969ab), however they state that the structure is stable between 1.2 and 1.5 GPa, while this mineral was obtained ``From drillcore into a contact metasomatized limestone near a quartz diorite intrusion associated with a copper deposit in skarn.'' (Downs, 2003). 
 CaB$_{2}$O$_{4}$ exists in at least four phase (Marezio, 1969ab): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP28_60_d_c_2d-001}{The ground state}, stable below 1.2 GPa, {\em Strukturbericht} $E3_{2}$ \item Orthorhombic high pressure structure, presumably this calciborite structure \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP84_33_6a_3a_12a-001}{Orthorhombic high pressure structure}, stable between 1.5 and 2.5 GPa \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_cP84_205_d_ac_2d-001}{Cubic high pressure structure}, stable between 2.5 and 4.0 GPa \end{itemize}
